thread.title: Longhorns led to slaughter by TCU
thread.title_full: Longhorns led to slaughter by TCU - San Antonio Express-News

author: Mike Finger
title: Longhorns led to slaughter by TCU
text:
Photo: Tom Pennington, Staff / Getty Images Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 FORT WORTH, TX - OCTOBER 03: Head coach Gary Patterson of the TCU Horned Frogs throws a game ball into the stands after the Horned Frogs beat the Texas Longhorns 50-7 at Amon G. Carter Stadium on October 3, 2015 in Fort Worth, Texas. (Photo by Tom Pennington/Getty Images)
Photo: Tom Pennington, Staff / Getty Images FORT WORTH, TX - OCTOBER 03: Head coach Gary Patterson of the TCU... Longhorns led to slaughter by TCU 1 / 1 Back to Gallery FORT WORTH — Early in the fourth quarter at the stadium serving as Cowtown’s biggest slaughterhouse Saturday, the referee announced Texas had been penalized for sending “disconcerting signals.”
The flag could’ve been thrown much, much sooner.
To the Longhorns, it was disconcerting when they turned the ball over on their first possession. It was disconcerting when they allowed four touchdowns by the end of the first quarter. It was disconcerting when one of their players apparently picked up his phone during halftime and reposted a Twitter message about transferring.
And in a thorough 50-7 TCU romp that left UT coach Charlie Strong looking like he’d witnessed a crime against humanity, it was disconcerting how all of the Longhorns’ claims of progress were obliterated.
For more, visit ExpressNews.com
